description.narrative: Output 8.5: Strategies to address crosscutting issues related to child rights are developed and applied., which contributes to Gender Discriminatory Roles And Practices, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Unicef Capacity For Programming On Gender. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 08: Country programme is efficiently designed, coordinated, managed and supported to meet quality programming standards in achieving results for children

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 8.5: Strategies to address crosscutting issues related to child rights are developed and applied.

description.narrative: The government approved and launched the National Disability Policy through UNICEF’s advocacy and technical inputs. ;The CO also developed a multi-sectoral disability programme and secured resources for disability programming. The CO also developed Office-wide Protection from Sexual Exploitation and Abuse (PSEA) and Disability actions plans and conducted a SEA risk assessment for CSO partners which gave each partner a risk rating. UNICEF used the WASH Gender Based Violence (GBV) study and the Gender Programmatic Review (GPR) to finalise the ;Programme Document 2022-2026. Finally, 95% of children in need were reached with appropriate humanitarian interventions by UNICEF, despite limited funding. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:21/01/2022
